Name: East Village Athletic Club
Ingredients: 22.5 ml Grand Marnier or other cognac orange liqueur
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Garnish with lime wedge on rim.
Review: Essentially a Last Word with tequila instead of gin.
History: The Last Word , a vintage cocktail classic, was first documented in Ted Saucier's Bottoms Up in 1951 where its creation was attributed to the Detroit Athletic Club. In 2008, the folk at New York's PDT bar tinkered with the recipe to create this drink named after their own hood.
Nutrition: One serving of East Village Athletic Club contains 187 calories
